name: Multiplexed Array
description: The MA data type is used to represent waveform data or continuous measurements as multiplexed arrays. It supports the transmission of digital samples from medical devices such as ECG machines, monitors, and other diagnostic equipment. MA provides a structured way to encode time-series data with multiple channels, sample rates, and measurement units, commonly used for physiological signals and continuous monitoring data.

MA.1.name: Sample 1 From Channel 1
MA.1.description: The first sample value from the first channel. Represents a single data point in the waveform or measurement series.

MA.2.name: Sample 1 From Channel 2
MA.2.description: The first sample value from the second channel. Used when multiple channels are being transmitted simultaneously.

MA.3.name: Sample 1 From Channel N
MA.3.description: The first sample value from the Nth channel. Additional channels as needed for multi-channel recordings.

MA.4.name: Sample 2 From Channel 1
MA.4.description: The second sample value from the first channel. Continues the time series data for the first channel.

MA.5.name: Sample 2 From Channel 2
MA.5.description: The second sample value from the second channel. Continues the time series data for the second channel.

MA.6.name: Sample 2 From Channel N
MA.6.description: The second sample value from the Nth channel. Pattern continues for all samples and channels.

constraints.multiplexing: Samples are interleaved by channel (all channel 1 samples, then channel 2, etc.)
constraints.sampleOrder: Samples must be in chronological order within each channel
constraints.channelConsistency: All channels should have the same number of samples
constraints.dataIntegrity: Missing samples should be explicitly handled or marked

commonFields: OBX.5 - Observation Value for waveform data

generationHints.typical: Use realistic physiological signal patterns appropriate for the measurement type
generationHints.ecgPatterns: Generate QRS complex patterns with appropriate intervals and amplitudes
generationHints.vitalSigns: Create continuous vital sign data with realistic variations
generationHints.sampleRates: Common rates: 125Hz, 250Hz, 500Hz, 1000Hz for different signal types
generationHints.channels: ECG typically 12 channels, EEG 16-32 channels, simple monitors 1-4 channels

ecg.channels: Typically 12 leads (I, II, III, aVR, aVL, aVF, V1-V6)

multiplexingPattern.structure: Channel 1 Sample 1, Channel 2 Sample 1, ..., Channel N Sample 1, Channel 1 Sample 2, ...
multiplexingPattern.example: For 3 channels with 2 samples each: C1S1^C2S1^C3S1^C1S2^C2S2^C3S2
multiplexingPattern.synchronization: All channels sampled at the same time point

validationRules.numericValidation: All sample values must be valid numeric values
validationRules.channelIntegrity: Each channel must have the same number of samples
validationRules.rangeValidation: Sample values should be within physiological ranges for the signal type
validationRules.sampleRateConsistency: Sampling rate must be consistent throughout the array
validationRules.dataCompleteness: Missing samples should be handled according to protocol

signalProcessing.filtering: May require digital filtering for noise reduction
signalProcessing.compression: Large arrays may benefit from compression techniques
signalProcessing.calibration: Raw values may need calibration to physical units
signalProcessing.synchronization: Multi-channel data requires proper time alignment

clinicalContext.trending: Long-term trend analysis of physiological signals
clinicalContext.research: Clinical research and signal analysis studies

relatedDataTypes.SN: Structured Numeric - for single measurements with operators

relatedDataTypes.ED: Encapsulated Data - for complex waveform with metadata

implementationNotes.storage: Consider compression for long-term storage of waveform data
implementationNotes.display: Requires specialized visualization for waveform rendering
implementationNotes.streaming: May be transmitted in real-time streaming scenarios
implementationNotes.standards: Follow medical device standards for waveform encoding

deviceIntegration.buffering: May require buffering for continuous data streams
